entry.title: STING induces ZBP1-mediated necroptosis independently of TNFR1 and FADD
entry.content:
STING induces ZBP1-mediated necroptosis independently of TNFR1 and FADD

  • Konstantinos Kelepouras
  • Julia Saggau
  • Gianmaria Liccardi
Article20 Aug 2025

entry.title: Structural basis for the dynamic regulation of mTORC1 by amino acids
entry.content:
Structural basis for the dynamic regulation of mTORC1 by amino acids

Using cryo-electron microscopy, the interactions of Sestrin2 and CASTOR1 with GATOR2 were resolved, revealing how mTORC1 activation is regulated and how nutrient availability triggers signalling for cellular growth.

  • Max L. Valenstein
  • Maximilian Wranik
  • Kacper B. Rogala
ArticleOpen Access20 Aug 2025

entry.title: mAChR4 suppresses liver disease via GAP-induced antimicrobial immunity
entry.content:
mAChR4 suppresses liver disease via GAP-induced antimicrobial immunity

Chronic alcohol use in humans and mice downregulates small intestinal mAChR4 and reduces goblet-cell-associated antigen passage formation, disrupting antimicrobial immunity.

  • Cristina Llorente
  • Fernanda Raya Tonetti
  • Bernd Schnabl
Article20 Aug 2025

entry.title: Molecular mechanism of ultrafast transport by plasma membrane Ca2+-ATPases
entry.content:
Molecular mechanism of ultrafast transport by plasma membrane Ca2+-ATPases

Structural insights into ultrafast Ca2+ transport by plasma membrane Ca2+-ATPases are provided, highlighting an essential role for PtdIns(4,5)P2 dynamics.

  • Deivanayagabarathy Vinayagam
  • Oleg Sitsel
  • Stefan Raunser
ArticleOpen Access20 Aug 2025

entry.title: Proximity screening greatly enhances electronic quality of graphene
entry.content:
Proximity screening greatly enhances electronic quality of graphene

Screening by a graphite gate placed at 1 nm proximity to graphene produces transformative improvement in its electronic quality, reducing charge inhomogeneity by two orders of magnitude.

  • Daniil Domaretskiy
  • Zefei Wu
  • Andre K. Geim
ArticleOpen Access20 Aug 2025

entry.title: TCF1 and LEF1 promote B-1a cell homeostasis and regulatory function
entry.content:
TCF1 and LEF1 promote B-1a cell homeostasis and regulatory function

The transcription factors TCF1 and LEF1 promote self-renewal and regulatory functions in B-1a cells.

  • Qian Shen
  • Hao Wang
  • Carola G. Vinuesa
ArticleOpen Access20 Aug 2025

entry.title: Experimental determination of partial charges with electron diffraction
entry.content:
Experimental determination of partial charges with electron diffraction

An experimental method is used to assign partial charges based on crystal structure determination through electron diffraction, applicable to any crystalline compound.

  • Soheil Mahmoudi
  • Tim Gruene
  • Bernhard K. Keppler
ArticleOpen Access20 Aug 2025

entry.title: Targeting G1–S-checkpoint-compromised cancers with cyclin A/B RxL inhibitors
entry.content:
Targeting G1–S-checkpoint-compromised cancers with cyclin A/B RxL inhibitors

Dual cyclin A/B RxL inhibitors selectively kill small cell lung cancer cells and other cancer cells with high E2F activity.

  • Shilpa Singh
  • Catherine E. Gleason
  • Matthew G. Oser
ArticleOpen Access20 Aug 2025

entry.title: Realization of a doped quantum antiferromagnet in a Rydberg tweezer array
entry.content:
Realization of a doped quantum antiferromagnet in a Rydberg tweezer array

A doped quantum antiferromagnet is obtained by using a Rydberg tweezer array comprising three levels encoding spins and holes to implement a tunable model that allows the study of previously inaccessible parameter regimes.

  • Mu Qiao
  • Gabriel Emperauger
  • Antoine Browaeys
Article20 Aug 2025

entry.title: Electron flow matching for generative reaction mechanism prediction
entry.content:
Electron flow matching for generative reaction mechanism prediction

A new tool based on generative machine learning called FlowER uses flow matching to model reactions as the redistribution of electrons between reactants and products, enabling the enforcement of mass conservation in reaction prediction.

  • Joonyoung F. Joung
  • Mun Hong Fong
  • Connor W. Coley
Article20 Aug 2025

entry.title: A fluorescent-protein spin qubit
entry.content:
A fluorescent-protein spin qubit

An optically addressable fluorescent-protein spin qubit is realized using enhanced yellow fluorescent protein; the qubit can be coherently controlled at liquid-nitrogen temperatures and the spin detected at room temperature in cells.

  • Jacob S. Feder
  • Benjamin S. Soloway
  • Peter C. Maurer
ArticleOpen Access20 Aug 2025

entry.title: Electrochemical loading enhances deuterium fusion rates in a metal target
entry.content:
Electrochemical loading enhances deuterium fusion rates in a metal target

A benchtop fusion reactor, called the Thunderbird Reactor, is described, showing that electrochemically loading a metal lattice with deuterium could enhance nuclear fusion rates when that metal is also bombarded by deuterium ions.

  • Kuo-Yi Chen
  • Jannis Maiwald
  • Curtis P. Berlinguette
ArticleOpen Access20 Aug 2025

entry.title: Thymic epithelial cells amplify epigenetic noise to promote immune tolerance
entry.content:
Thymic epithelial cells amplify epigenetic noise to promote immune tolerance

The activity of the tumour-suppressor protein p53 is repressed in the thymus to augment fluctuations in background chromatin accessibility as a means of mediating ectopic gene expression and immune tolerance.

  • Noah Gamble
  • Jason A. Caldwell
  • Andrew S. Koh
ArticleOpen Access20 Aug 2025

entry.title: Engineered yeast provides rare but essential pollen sterols for honeybees
entry.content:
Engineered yeast provides rare but essential pollen sterols for honeybees

Genetic engineering of a yeast strain provides rare but essential pollen sterols for honeybee colonies.

  • Elynor Moore
  • Raquel T. de Sousa
  • Geraldine A. Wright
ArticleOpen Access20 Aug 2025

entry.title: Extremely stripped supernova reveals a silicon and sulfur formation site
entry.content:
Extremely stripped supernova reveals a silicon and sulfur formation site

Observations of SN 2021yfj reveal that its progenitor is a massive star stripped down to its O/Si/S core, which remarkably continued to expel vast quantities of silicon-, sulfur-, and argon-rich material before the explosion, informing us that current theories for how stars evolve are too narrow.

  • Steve Schulze
  • Avishay Gal-Yam
  • Shrinivas R. Kulkarni
Article20 Aug 2025

entry.title: Atomic dynamics of gas-dependent oxide reducibility
entry.content:
Atomic dynamics of gas-dependent oxide reducibility

Environmental transmission electron microscopy reveals distinct atomistic pathways for the reduction of NiO to metallic nickel by CO and H2, with H2 more effective in transforming the entire bulk material.

  • Xiaobo Chen
  • Jianyu Wang
  • Guangwen Zhou
Article20 Aug 2025

entry.title: Cancer-induced nerve injury promotes resistance to anti-PD-1 therapy
entry.content:
Cancer-induced nerve injury promotes resistance to anti-PD-1 therapy

Perineural invasion and cancer-induced nerve injury of tumour-associated nerves are associated with poor response to anti-PD-1 therapy, which can be reversed by combining anti-PD-1 therapy with anti-inflammatory interventions.

  • Erez N. Baruch
  • Frederico O. Gleber-Netto
  • Moran Amit
ArticleOpen Access20 Aug 2025

entry.title: A novel bacterial protein family that catalyses nitrous oxide reduction
entry.content:
A novel bacterial protein family that catalyses nitrous oxide reduction

Cultivation of tropical soil microorganisms combined with physiological experiments and bioinformatics analyses identify a family of clade III lactonase-type nitrous oxide reductases with low sequence identity but high 3D structural similarity to known nitrous oxide reductases.

  • Guang He
  • Weijiao Wang
  • Frank E. Löffler
Article20 Aug 2025

entry.title: SLC45A4 is a pain gene encoding a neuronal polyamine transporter
entry.content:
SLC45A4 is a pain gene encoding a neuronal polyamine transporter

The SLC45A4 gene encodes a neuronal polyamine transporter and is linked to pain response in humans and mice.

  • Steven J. Middleton
  • Sigurbjörn Markússon
  • David L. Bennett
ArticleOpen Access20 Aug 2025

entry.title: A missing enzyme-rescue metabolite as cause of a rare skeletal dysplasia
entry.content:
A missing enzyme-rescue metabolite as cause of a rare skeletal dysplasia

In mammals, the enzyme TGDS produces UDP-4-keto-6-deoxyglucose, which binds to the catalytic pocket of UDP-xylose synthase, thereby regenerating the essential NAD+ cofactor of UDP-xylose synthase in conditions of low NAD+.

  • Jean Jacobs
  • Hristiana Lyubenova
  • Guido T. Bommer
ArticleOpen Access20 Aug 2025
